channel.title: Display driver crashing
channel.description:
Lately when I try to run some of my games, I always get this error after about 1-5 minutes into any game.: [img]http://i203.photobucket.com/albums/aa234/_M0d_M0par1946/errorsadface.png[/img] When I get the error, my screen freezes up and after about 10 seconds it returns back to the game.Sadly,this error keeps repeating while I try to run any game on my computer.
I have tried as much as I can to fix this, searched google, updated my video driver and so on... My video card is a pretty new card(bought about 1-2 months ago). it is an [b]AMD radeon HD 6700 series.[/b] I have never encountered this problem until now.
So my question is, how would I go about fixing this?

item.title: Display driver crashing
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:7, topic:429897”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=532578.msg3893109#msg3893109 date=1327076072]

Getting the exact same thing! If you find out what it is please do tell me as I cba scrolling through everything. Most promising thing I’ve found that it might be was a buggy Adobe update, I haven’t acted on it though.

I get this usually when I have Youtube playing in the background D:.
[/quote]What OS/Web browser/web browser version are you using?

Depends what mood I’m in/ what i’m doing but usually Chrome/win7/latest one[/quote]the way windows 7 and windows vista runs it makes the display driver go “idle” when not being used. Therefore, it’s eating memory even though it’s not being used.

I highly suggest trying to use Windows xp.

You can also try to use firefox for heavy graphical items such as youtube etc. This is because while google chrome is a fast browser the performance for adobe etc isn’t as good yet as Firefox is.

Read full topic

item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

Overheating can cause this.

item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

My gay vistas laptop does the same thing. I hate it, when I play a game, I’ll get about 20 FPS on it, then when it does that I’ll get about 6-9 FPS. I’m looking at upgrading my entire laptop though since thats a piece of shit

Best of Luck to your problem :3

item.title: Display driver crashing
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

-Update Driver
-System Restore
-CONFIGURE THE DRIVER?
-Allow more memory
-Considering it is still under warranty you could as get it looked at by the manufacturer.

other possibilities include:

-motherboard may be overheating.
–You may want to go into the fan and clean it off to make sure it is able to run fine. I had a similar issue with my laptop once where the motherboard would overheat because the fan had got fuzz or something all in it.

Go to Control Panel -> Devices Manager
Have You got there any yellow signs?

  1. Open REGEDIT

  2. Using Windows 7, go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\ControlSet002\Control\GraphicsDrivers

  3. Once there you will most likely have to create a new DWORD (32bit users) or QWORD (64bit users). Name it TdrDelay.

  4. Once created, change the value to 8. This will allow the GPU 8 seconds to respond instead of 2 seconds.

-there is of course the solution of replacement as well

You could also try degrading to another OS such as windows xp, the other OS’s are so tiring on the memory.

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/hardware/gg487368.aspx

Read full topic

item.title: Display driver crashing
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

[quote=“Mr Mopar, post:1, topic:429897”]Lately when I try to run some of my games, I always get this error after about 1-5 minutes into any game.:

When I get the error, my screen freezes up and after about 10 seconds it returns back to the game.Sadly,this error keeps
repeating while I try to run any game on my computer.

I have tried as much as I can to fix this, searched google, updated my video driver and so on…
My video card is a pretty new card(bought about 1-2 months ago). it is an AMD radeon HD 6700 series.
I have never encountered this problem until now.

So my question is, how would I go about fixing this?[/quote]
Update drivers, and if that doesn’t fix it, do a system restore to before it started screwing up.

Read full topic
